clues.text: Oldspeak referred to this language spoken by about 1.5 billion today
Most sex was outlawed, so artsem, short for this, was preferred for reproduction
Taking place every day after morning wake-up, "physical jerks" were these & were mandatory
Pondering unspoken forbidden beliefs was a thiscrime
To "rectify" was the euphemism used by this ministry for its deliberate altering of history
2-word name for what in theory is the lowest possible temperature
Chemically, many hormones are peptides, which are molecules structured like these other "P" ones, but smaller
You can't use a Carnot engine to power your car--it's an ideal one that loses no heat via this resisting force
The last letter of the Greek alphabet represents this unit of electrical resistance
Frederic Clements & Victor Shelford coined this 5-letter word for a zone of life, such as desert or deciduous forest
It took only about 350 years for this musical "Man" to ride forth from Cervantes' "Don Quixote"
In 2018 "Fiddler on the Roof" was staged in NYC in this language of Sholem Alechiem's original stories
Characters from "War and Peace" populate "Natasha", him "and the Great Comet of 1812"
Show your luck & name this musical based on Damon Runyon stories including "The Idyll of Miss Sarah Brown"
The musical "Big River" was inspired by this novel first published in the U.S. in 1885
At 3,210 feet, Scafell Pike in Lake District National Park is the highest elevation in this U.K. country
Snowshoe Mountain is a nearly 5,000-foot ski site in this U.S. "Mountain State"
The second-highest mountain peak in the world, it tops out at 28,251 feet
All of Romania's mountains are part of this 900-mile-long range
This "Dome" is the highest peak in the Great Smoky Mountains & in Tennessee
It's the 4-letter word for a news reporter's area of specialization, like sports or business
3-word phrase for information given to a reporter from a source who doesn't want to be named
The term "hard pass" was in the news in November 2018--it's what reporters need to come & go in this building
Frank Magid created the action news format, including the now-common "happy talk", banter between these people
In a newspaper office old clippings, not dead bodies, are kept here
In the 1930s Wallace Carothers developed this fabric, synonymous with stockings by 1940
Construction on this NYC landmark began on March 17, 1930; framework rose 4 1/2 stories per week, for a lot of weeks
The 4 murdered daughters of Russia's last czar were Olga, Tatiana, Maria & this one whom many women later claimed to be
Dateline: Chicago, 1926! Gunmen put 1,000 rounds into this mug's Cicero Hotel HQ, but he comes out smellin' like a rose!
On Sept. 1, 1969 King Idris suddenly became ex-royalty in this African country & a colonel took power
This state has a state bluegrass song
Hawaii made the pahu the state traditional instrument & this the state modern instrument
A patriotic tune, this state song of Connecticut is probably the only one to contain the name of a pasta
Florida's state song is this Stephen Foster song subtitled "Old Folks At Home"
Bob Wills pioneered the country style called western this & Texas made it its state music

clues.text: It's the walkway between rows of airplane seats

To treat a liquid with a gas
In Bermuda, kites are a tradition on this day marking Jesus' crucifixion, to symbolize his future ascension to heaven
This man used a Leyden jar & a metal key in his famous 1752 kite experiment
Around 1900 these 2 brothers tested their biplane designs as kites
The multiline apparatus used to control a kite is called this, also the headgear of a horse's harness
A kite was used to carry a cable across this river between New York & Canada to help build its first suspension bridge
As sure as the wind blows, "Mary Poppins Returns" to save the day with help from this actress in the title role
At shopdisney.com you can purchase one of these accessories of Mary's complete with a parrot head
After Audrey Hepburn beat her out for the role of Eliza in "My Fair Lady", she agreed to play Mary Poppins & won an Oscar
This 2013 film starring Tom Hanks told the true story of Walt Disney's struggle to bring "Mary Poppins" to the big screen
Marc Shaiman & Scott Wittman wrote all new songs for "Mary Poppins Returns", while these brothers wrote the original movie's songs

rounds.text: Dostoyevsky wrote that this title man in an earlier European novel is "beautiful only because he is ridiculous"
